title: Two more murder charges over man found dead in Bushey flat
article: Two more people have been charged with murdering a man found dead in a flat. Vishal Gohel, 44, was found unresponsive inside the home in High Street, Bushey, on 23 January and died at the scene, Hertfordshire Police said. Tianna Edwards-Hancock, 18, from Barking, east London, and Tervin Leslie, 21, from south-east London are now accused of killing Mr Gohel. Two women have already been charged with his murder. Georgia Bruce-Annan, 20, of Harts Lane, and Faith Hoppie, 21, of Blake Avenue, both from Barking, east London, appeared before magistrates in St Albans on Friday. Ms Edwards-Hancock, of Fresh Wharf Road, and Mr Leslie, of Hurst Street, Lambeth, will appear before magistrates later. A 23-year-old has also been arrested and remains in police custody. Det Insp Justine Jenkins, from the Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire and Hertfordshire (BCH) Major Crime Unit, said: "While we have now charged four people with murder, we are still keen to hear from any witnesses or anyone with information."Please don't hesitate to get in touch with any information, no matter how small it might seem, it could be vital for our investigation."
